--- title: "Homework 1" output: html_document --- Parvin Siva ```{r setup, include=FALSE} knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE) ``` ## Quadratic Equations This assignment looks at quadratic equations. A script was created with a function called "quad()" which implements the quadratic equation y=ax^2+bx+c where y is the return value and (x,a,b,c) are the arguments. Default values for a,b, and c were given. ```{r cars} ``` ## a=1, b=1, c=0 When the parameter c=0, the output we get will be: ```{r pressure, echo=FALSE} quad<-function(x,a=0,b=0,c=0){ y=a*(x^2)+(b*x)+c return(y) } x <- seq(from=-10, to=10, by=.5) y <- quad(x,a=1,b=1) plot(x,y) ``` We can see that it is a non-linear equation, where b is the slope and c is the intercept. ## a=1, b=0, c=1 ```{r} x <- seq(from=-10, to=10, by=.5) y <- quad(x,a=1,c=1) plot(x,y) ``` When the parameter b=0, the graph looks like a quadratic function with a vertice of (0,0) ##a=0, b=1, c=1 ```{r} x <- seq(from=-10, to=10, by=.5) y <- quad(x,b=1,c=1) plot(x,y) ``` When parameter a=0, we see a linear graph with a negative y intercept ##a=0, b=0, c=1 ```{r} x <- seq(from=-10, to=10, by=.5) y <- quad(x,c=1) plot(x,y) ``` When parameters a and b are set to 0, we see a horizontal line with a y-intercept=1. ##a=0, b=1, c=0 ```{r} x <- seq(from=-10, to=10, by=.5) y <- quad(x,b=1) plot(x,y) ``` When parameters a and c are set to 0, we see a positive linear graph with negative x-interceipt and negative y-intercept. ##a=1, b=0, c=0 ```{r} x <- seq(from=-10, to=10, by=.5) y <- quad(x,a=1) plot(x,y) ``` When parameters b and c are set to 0, we see a quadrative graph with a vertice at (0,0)
